question: Consider the following statements:
Statement (I): If either <katex>$|\vec{a}|=0$</katex> or <katex>$|\vec{b}|=0$</katex>, then <katex>$\vec{a} \cdot \vec{b} = 0$</katex>
Statement (II): If <katex>$\vec{a} \times \vec{b} = \vec{0}$</katex>, then a is perpendicular to b.
Which of the following is correct?
choices: Statement (I) is true but Statement (II) is false
Statement (I) is false but Statement (II) is true
Both Statement (I) and Statement (II) is true
Both Statement (I) and Statement (II) is false
explanation: Statement I is true (zero vector dot product is 0).
Statement II is false (cross product zero implies vectors are parallel, not perpendicular).
